attributes.action: Stop charging young people and students ridicules money on a night out in London
attributes.additional_details:
It's hard enough for the younger generation that are only just starting out in life and working hard and trying their best to survive, its important that we are not forgotten, and thought about. 
A night out in London these days cost a lot of money,
And for the mental health of our generation its important that we go out and socialise, 
But why do we have to pay such a hefty price for it ?
attributes.background: The government should put a cap in place whereby young people e.g. ages 18-25 and students pay £5 per drink in bars and clubs across the UK

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about the cost of entry to, and drinks at, hospitality venues are a matter for individual hospitality venues, not the UK Government or Parliament.
